Fun!
Terrific. Great Antarctic scenes.

I used to play this game on my galaxy s8, now suddenly it says that only older version of android phones support this game. So I can't play THE GAME I PAID MONEY FOR EVEN THOUGH I STILL AM USING THE SAME PHONE AS BEFORE WHEN IT PLAYED JUST FINE. REFUND OR YOU'RE JUST A BUNCH OF CON ARTISTS
replyContent: Hi Candace, Android will show this message when you open any older app that has not had a recent update. However, we are not aware of any issues with playing the app on Android 9 - if you click 'OK on Google's message you should be able to play fine just like before. If you're having issues playing, please let us know at contact@inertiasoftware.com

What an amazing adventure, perfect balance between challenging and rewarding. Thank you developers, please make more.
Ten stars!!!

I loved Darkmoor Manor from Inertia so kept checking for other point and click game from this developer. I have ignored Facility 47 for quite some time, because the setting wasn't really to my liking (I prefer fantasy settings or old-fashioned manor house escapes), but I'm glad I finally did download it. Great puzzles, not too easy but not too hard either, good graphics and overall a very well-made and rather long game. Didn't stumble upon any glitches. Well done Inertia, can't wait for your next point and click adventure!
Superb
Some of the puzzles were above my head but I was hooked on the story and the challenge! Great graphics too. I definitely recommend you play this game.

Often the link to the next move is just impossibly arcane. It would be difficult to sustain one's interest without buying enough hints to increase the cost of the game considerably. That said, it really is a lot of fun. The period setting arouses nostalgia for the pre-PC era of computing.
Great game. Challenges are quite difficult. Will definitely buy more from these devs.
Really interesting story!

And with a great deal of attention to details here, such a wonderful musical score which I think also really compliments everything along with the main storyline in the game. I suppose that if one was to finding with some areas for improvement, maybe if, so there was possibly more hints included along with the game itself but not really all that expensive to purchase more of them, if need be. Keep up all the good work for all the developers working at the 'Inertia Software because you're really doing a marvelous job creating with all these fine products!

replyContent: Hi Louise, sorry to hear about this - we have a couple of things to check which may possibly help, please could you message us on Facebook fb.com/msg/facility47, or if you don't have Facebook access, you can email us using the Send Email link on this app page.

content: Really enjoyed it.Looking forward to the next release

This is nothing short of a fantastic game. I honestly didn't expect too much from a puzzle game on the app store, but boy was I in for a treat. The graphics are really good, the environments are lovely to look at and the story is fun and pretty engaging.   But the puzzles. Ohhh the puzzles. They are SO GOOD. I play a lot of these kinds of games and I'm pretty darn harsh on this point, but Facility 47 just keeps throwing creative after creative puzzle at you. Every time I used a hint, I felt silly that I hadn't thought of the solution. And when I did solve a few of the better puzzles, I actually giggled out loud in satisfaction. My ONLY gripe is that you probably will use a hint or two. Not because the puzzles are obtuse or poorly designed, but because you always have access to every screen previously visited. This means searching for a missed clue or item or puzzle can be extremely difficult. The game usually doesn't make you back track all that far, but it does raise the game's difficulty somewhat unnecessarily.    That point aside, if you are at all looking for a creative adventure puzzler, GET THIS NAO. It's just great, and for an app store game, it's a "masterpiece" that rivals The Room.
Compelling puzzle adventure with great atmosphere. The puzzles are not so hard they're impossible but not so easy they're unsatisfying.
Nice
Great game ! Looking forward to playing the next one !
Awesome game! Puzzles are tricky but solvable. Very well thought out!

Should not need to pay for hints..... Or bulk buy for less

I have played many free  games and purchased many. This is the only game that I was very disappointed about and almost gave it only one star. At first I played part of the game free to see if Iiked it. During the game, I noticed that the hints had to be purchased after using the first 3. So I assumed that if I purchased the game, I wouldn't have to pay for the hints. I was wrong. The first 3 hints are free and then the rest of them, you have to purchase. This is the only game out of many many that I've played/ purchased that the hints cost money. Very greedy. Other than that, the graphics are very good and it is really a fun game to play. If you pay for the game, the hints should not cost anything.

replyContent: Hi Guud, sorry to hear about the trouble you've had, if you haven't already please send us an email using the Send Email link on this app page, attaching copies of your Google Play receipts, and we can get this sorted for you.

I don't have to be Stephen Hawking to solve the problems and the problems roll along naturally as if I was really there and alone. What might I do if this situation fell upon me. Please, keep it up. The interface is clean and its easy to use, and there are a good few hours of gameplay to get through. I did get completely stuck on 2 occasions, but there is a hint system to use.  Not quite 5 stars due to one puzzle that I don't think I would ever have figured out by myself (maybe It's just a case of sour grapes) but still totally worth the money.

Great storyline and it's a great challenge.
